Dialogue.NPCText:
A massive, black-furred figure crouches by the village edge, hunched in the snow. He wears a horned mask, a kilt of thick wool, and a frost-encrusted cloak that stirs in the wind.
As you approach, he tosses a smooth pebble into the air, catching it with a calloused paw. His blue eyes regard you with gentle intelligence.

He says nothing, but nods—then draws a series of symbols in the snow at your feet.

Durn Hollowtooth is mute. He communicates by gesture, stones, and the sign language taught by Irinya, the Ice Seer.

Option.text: Try to communicate in simple signs.
Wait and see what he does.
You’re Durn Hollowtooth, right? Irinya speaks highly of you.
Gesture to learn more about him.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn grins, flashing broad white teeth. He taps his heart, points at you, then makes a wide circle over his head.
With deliberate care, he arranges three pebbles in a triangle, and places a fourth at the triangle’s edge—then gestures northeast, toward the frozen wilds.

He seems to be inviting you to listen, or perhaps to follow him…

Option.text: Nod and gesture for him to continue.
Attempt to mimic his gesture, placing a pebble as he did.
Ask about the triangle and pebble.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn watches you for a long, silent moment.
Then, gently, he offers you a cold, perfectly round stone. When you take it, a sudden chill stirs in your mind—a fleeting vision of a distant shrine, buried beneath blue ice, and the song of a woman's laughter echoing through the storm.

Durn points toward the vision, his hand trembling, then pounds his chest and points to you. He needs help.

Option.text: Accept the quest to investigate the vision.
Try to ask what the vision means.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn’s eyes brighten, and he taps his horned mask. He points to the sky, then mimes listening, then makes a swirling motion—perhaps suggesting he hears the “whispers” of the wind, as Irinya does.
He traces a symbol on the snow—two intersecting spirals, the sign Irinya uses for “destiny.”
Then, quietly, he holds up a pebble, showing it to you. It’s etched with a single rune: “Danger”.

Option.text: Ask if Irinya has sent him.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn notices your interest in his garb. He bows slightly, spreading his arms.
He taps the fur cloak: Mantle of Shaggy Silence—then pulls at his kilt: Tundra Hunter’s Kilt. He lifts one enormous foot and waggles it—Frostbite Hide Boots. Finally, he points to his horned mask, holding it up so you glimpse the inside: blue runes glowing faintly.

Each piece seems to have a story. Durn traces a crescent on his armguard—perhaps a trophy from a battle, or a memory of his lost kin.

Option.text: Move the conversation back to his purpose.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn smiles, a bashful gleam in his eyes. He offers you a stone—this one painted with blue swirls.
He taps his chest, then draws a heart in the snow, and points to the village.
His gratitude is genuine, and it’s clear he loves Frostmere and its people deeply.

Option.text: You seem very loyal to this place.
Return to his reason for seeking you out.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn’s mood darkens. He holds up two fingers, then snaps one off and drops it, letting it vanish in the snow.
He then points to the mask, touches his heart, and then gestures toward the central lodge of Frostmere.
He may have lost family, but has found new kin here—likely Irinya, and perhaps the Silent Hunter.

Durn gives a solemn nod, then offers a comforting gesture—a warm, bear-like pat on your shoulder.
Then, with renewed resolve, he points northeast, clearly eager to guide you onward.

Durn crouches, sketching a crude shrine in the snow—an arch of blue stones, with a spiraling path.
He then mimes sleep, and makes a gesture of fright—clutching his head, then spreading his arms as if to show a monster looming.
Next, he draws a female figure with a long, swirling tail and wild hair. He taps it with a pebble, then shudders.
You recognize the signs: a vision of the Frosted Seductress, a cold-hearted spirit that haunts the old ice shrine and lures hunters to their doom.

Option.text: I will help—tell me what you need.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn nods grimly, then draws the village in the snow, with little stones for houses. He moves the “female” pebble closer, then knocks over two of the house-stones.
He mimes villagers falling asleep, then shivering and gasping for air.
The Frosted Seductress is not just haunting the shrine—she is draining the life and warmth from Frostmere itself.

Option.text: Is there a way to protect the villagers?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn pantomimes sleep, then jerks awake, eyes wide.
He taps his head, then points at his heart, then at you.
He gives you another stone—this one icy cold, with a small spiral etched on it.
Durn’s dreams are visions—warnings meant for those with the will to act. He trusts you to help.

Durn looks relieved. He presses his hands together in gratitude, then points northeast—toward the wild ice fields.
He draws a jagged path in the snow, placing a pebble at its end.
He then offers you a small pouch of frost-dusted stones—his “tokens of trust.”
You understand: Durn wants you to seek out and destroy the Frosted Seductress haunting the Forgotten Shrine beyond Frostmere, and bring back proof of her demise.

Option.text: Accept the quest. (Hunt the Frosted Seductress)
Is she truly a spirit, or something worse?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn offers a strong, silent handshake, then draws a spiral over your palm with a cold pebble.
He points northeast, then mimes you walking cautiously, and finally pantomimes striking a victory pose.
He will wait for your return, hoping for good news.

Durn sketches a rough map: Frostmere at the center, the Obelisk of Veyra to the north, and a spiral path leading to a half-ruined shrine on the edge of a frozen lake.
He taps the map three times—at dusk, midnight, and dawn.
The Frosted Seductress is most active when the sky shimmers, and her lair is near the frozen falls northeast of the Obelisk.

Durn withdraws a tiny frost-lotus from his pouch and mimes breathing in the icy scent.
He then mimes plucking a lock of hair and wraps it around the flower.
He seeks the Seductress’s Frozen Tress—a lock of her enchanted hair, proof you have truly faced her and survived her charms.

Option.text: I will bring you the Frozen Tress.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn shivers, wraps his cloak tighter, and mimes his own heart stopping.
He then makes the sign Irinya uses for “curse,” and draws the Obelisk in the snow, shadowed by a swirling spirit.
He believes the Seductress is not a true spirit, but a corruption—perhaps a fragment of Minax’s magic twisted by the shrine’s power.

Durn nods slowly, tapping his head, then drawing a spiral and a shield.
Irinya knows. She prepares wards against the Seductress even now—but they may not be ready in time.

Option.text: I will speak to her first.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn tilts his head, curious. He places a hand to his chest, then slowly draws a line in the snow—starting from a small stick-figure and ending at the large horned mask he wears.
He then gestures to you: Do you wish to know how he became who he is?

Option.text: Yes. I want to understand your path.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn draws two small figures in the snow—one with a tall staff (Irinya), and one childlike, hunched and horned.
He traces waves between them, then taps the sky and his heart.
He was found wandering the tundra by Irinya. She claimed his soul echoed the Obelisk’s song. She raised him like a son—part beast, part boy, part prophet.
He scratches a symbol: ❄, then crosses it out. A lost tribe? A vanished past?

Durn nods slowly.
He places five stones in a circle, then removes them one by one, burying them in snow. The last one he gives to you—frost-chilled, carved with a spiral and claw-mark.
You sense it’s a relic of his people—now gone, devoured by cold or corruption.

Durn clasps your shoulder with surprising tenderness.
He shares this with very few. You are now part of his memory. His tribe lives on, in part, through you.

Durn respectfully bows, then buries the stone in the snow, pressing it down like a grave marker.
Some burdens are not meant to be shared. But he holds no grudge.

Durn mimes a stern woman waving a staff—then pantomimes laughter, then tears.
He taps his mask, points to the air, and draws two spirals—“She taught me to hear the ice winds. To read the whispers of the stone.”
Then, he gives you a blue pebble, cool and shimmering slightly.

Option.text: Why do the stones whisper to you?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn crouches and draws the Obelisk of Veyra—a towering spire of jagged runes.
He places your pebble at its base, and gestures reverently.
He taps his temple, then points to the center of the village—then down—“The Obelisk sings to those who listen. Sometimes it warns. Sometimes... it screams.”

Option.text: What does it say to you?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Durn picks up a handful of snow, then crushes it.
He then draws a series of runes, each glowing faintly.
He touches one, and you suddenly hear the wind howl louder for a moment... or was it just your mind?
You feel momentarily attuned to the Obelisk’s pulse.

Durn’s eyes narrow. He points north—where the air thickens—and draws a red spiral into the snow, streaked with claw marks.
He pantomimes shadow spreading across the Obelisk.
Then he offers you two stones:
A bright white one… and a dark jagged shard.

Durn nods solemnly and presses his forehead to yours.
Your heart grows colder—but purer. The frost accepts your decision.

Durn frowns... but does not stop you.
The shard pulses in your hand. Somewhere far off, the wind carries your name... but not kindly.

Durn grins and pats your shoulder.
Balance is its own strength. Perhaps you’ll walk a path of your own.
